analysis package¶

Submodules¶

analysis.analyse module¶

analysis.analyse.correlation_matrix(dataset)¶

Create a correlation matrix with seaborn lib, save it as png into ./analysis/ Once the correlation matrix is created it’s shown on screen. :param dataset:

Pandas DataFrame object

Returns

None

analysis.analyse.mae(y_test, y_pred)¶

Compute the mean absolute error with sklearn lib

Parameters

  • y_test (array-like) – labels that correspond to the values of test dataset

  • y_pred (array-like) – labels that are predicted by the model based on values of train set

Returns

the mean absolute error

Raises

Exception – if the arguments don’t have same shapes

analysis.analyse.r2(y_test, y_pred)¶

Compute the r-square score with sklearn lib

Parameters

  • y_test (array-like) – labels that correspond to the values of test dataset

  • y_pred (array-like) – labels that are predicted by the model based on values of train set

Returns

r-square score

Raises

Exception – if the arguments don’t have same shapes

analysis.analyse.rmse(y_test, y_pred)¶

Compute the root-mean-square error with sklearn lib

Parameters

  • y_test (array-like) – labels that correspond to the values of test dataset

  • y_pred (array-like) – labels that are predicted by the model based on values of train set

Returns

the root-mean-square error

Raises

Exception – if the arguments don’t have same shapes
